description.narrative: (Ukraine): .This new activity will build confidence in Ukraine's democratic transition, reform process, and diversity through innovative, wide-reaching content and reform communications. Complementing existing USAID and USG activities, which work to strengthen independent media and develop sector self-governance, this program will directly support engaging, emotionally resonant content about social change and Ukraine's reform-oriented trajectory by working with a range of communications outlets and Ukraine's vibrant creative production industry through new formats such as blogging, infotainment, and social media marketing - complementing sector-focused USAID programs that disseminate information about specific reforms. These efforts will counter the continuing domination of negative narratives in Ukrainian media, which reinforce perceptions of rampant corruption and a slow reform process and drive many Ukrainians to seek out high-quality Russia-produced entertainment and information, especially online. The implementing partner will work with USAID to develop a strategic communications agenda of issues and reforms; underwrite innovative media content; conduct research and use social media analytics to track the influence of communications vectors and narratives; and build connections of Ukrainian commercial broadcasters and content producers with local civil society and activists, as well as with the U.S. private media sector. Countering disinformation and promoting Ukraine's democratic development is a key crosscutting objective (JRS 4.1, ICS 1.2). This activity will be coordinated with interagency partners and build upon the success of the Office of Transition Initiative. The OTI activity is scheduled to close-out in 4/2021, with grants ending in 1/2021. This activity will have three months for handover and lessons learned to ensure a successful transition...CAATSA 5: Independent Media and Civil Society $4,000,000... .
